intro: Raoulia hectorii var. mollis, commonly known as the Hector's raoulia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal areas and on rocky outcrops. This variety is distinguished by its softer, more hairy foliage compared to other varieties of Raoulia.
